content: Uptake of carbon is the main cause of ocean acidification, or the long-term trend of falling ocean pH. Ocean acidification poses a threat to marine ecosystems.
!Projected impacts from ocean acidification on marine ecosystems, resulting from the carbon emissions that would cause 2-3 ℃ warming. Source: Kroeker et al. [acidification_ocean].

Ocean acidification has negative impacts of fisheries, the ocean as a carbon sink, and the tourism, scentific, and cultural value of biodiversity [navrud]. Losses has been estimated to reach $1 trillion per year by 2100 under projected CO<sub>2</sub> emissions [cbd_acidification].
